docs.title: HodorReflexes.listClass
docs.text:
HodorReflexes.listClass : listClass {
    name: string,
    sv: table,
    sw: table,
    svDefault: table,
    svVersion: number,
    listHeaderHeight: number,
    listRowHeight: number,
    updateDebounceDelayMS: number,
    _nextTypeId: any,
    _redrawHeaders: boolean = true,
    logger: unknown,
    uiLocked: boolean = true,
    Update: function,
    ...(+50)
}

docs.title: class listClass
docs.text:
• supers: ZO_InitializingObject

base class for all lists

docs.title: listClass.Update
docs.text:
function listClass.Update()

MUST IMPLEMENT! function to update the list

docs.title: listClass.RunOnce
docs.text:
function listClass.RunOnce(
  funcName: string,
  ...: any
) -> result any

@param funcName - name of the function to run once

@param ... - arguments to pass to the function

@return result - of the function, or nil if the function does not exist

NOT for manual use! this is a helper function that runs a function only once and then removes it from the list instance. If you use it on a still needed function, it will be gone after the first call and thus break your list!

docs.title: listClass.Initialize
docs.text:
function listClass.Initialize(listDefinition: table) ->  nil

@param listDefinition - definition of the list

NOT for manual use! this gets automatically called by :New() when creating a new list instance. initializes the list with the given definition. calls CreateSavedVariables(), CreateControls() and CreateFragment() once and deletes them afterwards. sets up event listeners for group changes, ui lock/unlock and player data updates.

docs.title: listClass._updateDebouncedTrigger
docs.text: function listClass._updateDebouncedTrigger() ->  nil

docs.title: listClass.ResizeList
docs.text:
function listClass.ResizeList() ->  nil

NOT for manual use! this gets called to resize the list window based on the current data. calculates the total height of the list based on the data types and their heights.

docs.title: listClass.CreateUpdateRebouncedCallback
docs.text:
function listClass.CreateUpdateRebouncedCallback() -> debounced function

@return debounced - update callback function

NOT for manual use! this gets called to create the debounced update callback function. creates a function that can be used as a callback to update the list with debounce.

docs.title: listClass.UpdateDebounced
docs.text:
function listClass.UpdateDebounced(forceUpdate) ->  nil

NOT for manual use! this gets called to update the list with a debounce. debounce the update calls to prevent excessive updates

docs.title: listClass.IsEnabled
docs.text:
function listClass.IsEnabled() ->  boolean

@return - true if the list is enabled, false otherwise

NOT for manual use! this gets called to check if the list is enabled. checks if the list is enabled based on the saved variables and current conditions

docs.title: listClass.RefreshVisibility
docs.text:
function listClass.RefreshVisibility() ->  nil

NOT for manual use! this gets called to refresh the visibility of the list. refresh the visibility of the list based on the current conditions

docs.title: listClass.WindowFragmentCondition
docs.text:
function listClass.WindowFragmentCondition() ->  boolean

@return - true if the window fragment should be shown, false otherwise

NOT for manual use! this gets called to check the visibility condition function for the window fragment of the list. checks if the list should be shown based on the current conditions.

docs.title: listClass.CreateSavedVariables
docs.text:
function listClass.CreateSavedVariables() ->  nil

NOT for manual use! this gets called once when the list is initialized. Create saved variables for the list. sets default values if they are not provided during initialization.

docs.title: listClass.CreateControls
docs.text:
function listClass.CreateControls() ->  nil

NOT for manual use! this gets called once when the list is initialized. creates the window and controls for the list. the window is saved under sel.window and the scrollList control under self.listControl

docs.title: listClass.CreateFragment
docs.text:
function listClass.CreateFragment() ->  nil

NOT for manual use! this gets called once when the list is initialized. creates the window fragment for the list.

docs.title: listClass.RenderCurrentFightTimeToControl
docs.text:
function listClass.RenderCurrentFightTimeToControl(control: LabelControl) ->  nil

renders the current fight time to the control passed as argument. Can be used by custom themes as well.

docs.title: listClass.CreateFightTimeUpdaterOnControl
docs.text:
function listClass.CreateFightTimeUpdaterOnControl(control: LabelControl) ->  nil

@param control - the control to render the fight time to

creates and registers a fight time updater on the control passed as argument. Can be used by custom themes as well. WARNING: DO NOT use it on controls that get recycled (e.g. playerRows)! ONLY USE on headers or static labels! Otherwise the timers will pile up and cause performance issues. They do NOT get automatically cleaned up on control recycling!

docs.title: listClass.RenderTimeToControl
docs.text:
function listClass.RenderTimeToControl(
  control: LabelControl,
  timeMS: number,
  opacity: number?
) ->  nil

@param timeMS - time in milliseconds

@param opacity - optional opacity to set on the control

renders the given time (in milliseconds) to the control passed as argument. Can be used by custom themes as well.

docs.title: listClass.ApplySupportRangeStyle
docs.text:
function listClass.ApplySupportRangeStyle(
  rowControl: any,
  unitTag: string
) ->  nil

@param rowControl - the control to apply the style to

@param unitTag - the unit tag of the player

applies the support range style (transparent look) to the control passed as argument. Can be used by custom themes as well.

docs.title: listClass.ApplyUserNameToControl
docs.text:
function listClass.ApplyUserNameToControl(
  nameControl: LabelControl,
  userId: string
) ->  nil

@param nameControl - the control to render the name to

@param userId - the user id of the player

applies the user name to the control passed as argument. Can be used by custom themes as well.

docs.title: listClass.ApplyNameFontToControl
docs.text:
function listClass.ApplyNameFontToControl(labelControl: LabelControl) ->  nil

@param labelControl - the control to apply the font to

applies the name font to the control passed as argument. Can be used by custom themes as well.

docs.title: listClass.ApplyUserIconToControl
docs.text:
function listClass.ApplyUserIconToControl(
  iconControl: TextureControl,
  userId: string,
  classId: number
) ->  nil

@param iconControl - the control to render the icon to

@param userId - the user id of the player

@param classId - the class id of the player

applies the user icon to the control passed as argument and sets the texture to be released at zero references. Can be used by custom themes as well.

docs.title: listClass.CreateCountdownOnControl
docs.text:
function listClass.CreateCountdownOnControl(
  control: LabelControl,
  eventName: string,
  zeroTimerOpacity: number?
) ->  nil

@param control - the control to render the countdown to

@param eventName - the event name to register the countdown start callback to (must provide the following arguments: (unitTag, duration) where duration is in milliseconds)

@param zeroTimerOpacity - optional opacity to set on the control when the timer reaches zero (default: self.sw.zeroTimerOpacity or 0.7)

creates and registers a buff/debuff countdown timer on the control passed as argument. Can be used by custom themes as well. WARNING: DO NOT use it on controls that get recycled (e.g. playerRows)! ONLY USE on headers or static labels! Otherwise the timers will pile up and cause performance issues. They do NOT get automatically cleaned up on control recycling!
